DataElement.preferredName: Caries Periodontal Probe Assessment Longest Diameter Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the longest diameter measurement of decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous by a calibrated dental instrument used to measure periodontal pocket depth and/or clinical attachment level at various locations around the teeth.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the evaluation of decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous by a calibrated dental instrument used to measure periodontal pocket depth and/or clinical attachment level at various locations around the teeth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Concepts.definition: The decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

Property.preferredDefinition:
A calibrated dental instrument used to measure periodontal pocket depth and/or clinical attachment level
at various locations around the teeth. May also be used for other measurements in the mouth.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: A calibrated dental instrument used to measure periodontal pocket depth and/or clinical attachment level at various locations around the teeth. May also be used for other measurements in the mouth.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the determination of the size or magnitude of the greatest length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference of the decay of a tooth, in which it becomes softened, discolored, and/or porous.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.
Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

DataElement.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form
